column4: hey all - when i log in to my desktop, it thinks about it for a while, starts to load things, but gives up and goes back to the login. tried with different session types. any suggestions?
can you log into a text console and look to see if you're getting X errors?  (/var/log/Xorg.log.0)
i'll check. unfortunately i didn't think to run irc inside an emacs shell so i'll have to brb
there was something about GLX not loading properly. i used envy to reinstall the drivers, but no change
is that near the end of the log file?
what happens when you "startx" from a text console?
doing startx from my recovery console works fine
so you can log into a text console session and run startx and it runs fine, but you can't select any kind of a graphical session when you log in?
and you're just logging in as your own id every time, right?
yes - i can log in with other users fine >:|
you mean it's only one particular user who can't log in graphically?
yes
ok, that sounds like a corruption in one of the private config directories (~/.*)  unfortunately, I don't know how to identify which one.
yeah - i looked through them just now, none struck me as being x related...
many are   (.gnome*, .kde)
.emerald (if you're using beryl)
both gnome and beryl didn't work
I would try renaming the ".gnome" dir and try again. it should get recreated. i never start by removing such dirs, in case i make a mistake :)
i'll give it a shot
tried .gnome, .emereld, .beryl, .nautilus, moving them to a _old. no change :\

.fonts, .fontconfig, .qt?   sorry, you're on your own at this point. if you can't track it down through the use of /var/log/Xorg.log.0, /var/log/messages, and hacking at the config dirs, you might try just creating a new user and migrating the old files to it. that's a last resort though
